criteria: Strength of Connection Between Evidence and Analysis/Inference
descriptions: Minimal attempt to cite textual evidence; evidence is irrelevant or inaccurate.
Identifies some textual evidence, but it is weakly connected to the analysis or inference.
Cites relevant textual evidence that supports the analysis or inference, but the connection could be stronger.
Effectively cites textual evidence that clearly supports the analysis of explicit content or inferences drawn, demonstrating a good understanding of the text.
Masterfully selects the most compelling textual evidence, providing insightful analysis of explicit meanings and inferences, demonstrating a deep comprehension of the text.
No analysis or inference is made.
Analysis or inference is illogical or completely unsupported by the cited evidence.
Weak connection between textual evidence and analysis or inference; the reasoning is unclear.
Adequate connection between evidence and analysis/inference, but the reasoning could be more explicit.
Strong connection between cited evidence and analysis or inference; reasoning is logical and clearly explained.
Exemplary connection between evidence and analysis/inference; reasoning is insightful, nuanced, and convincingly demonstrates a thorough understanding of the text.
Demonstrates no understanding of the text.
Superficial understanding of the text; analysis is basic and inferences are missing or irrelevant.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of the text; analysis is simplistic, and inferences are weakly supported.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of the text; analysis is adequate, and inferences are reasonable but lack depth.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the text; analysis is insightful, and inferences are well-supported and thoughtful.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of the text; analysis is profound, and inferences are perceptive, original, and thoroughly justified.
